sub_title: Researcher / Lecturer Applied Data Science at Ambient Intelligence, Saxion University of Applied Sciences
summary:
A microbiologist/immunologist/geneticist turned researcher and teacher of applied (big) data science and applied machine learning / artificial intelligence.

My goal is to support the work of stakeholders across different fields by translating domain expert knowledge into functional and explainable data driven models that can be used for decision support.

While I enjoy working with all kinds of data, I do have a personal preference for projects based on data from "living beings", so health, medical, animal and (micro)biological data.
Go figure :)

Have done a lot of stuff, but in a nutshell, have: 
- 20+ years of experience (studying & working) in the fields of immunology, cell biology, molecular biology, microbiology/microbial ecology and genetics.
- 15+ years of experience (from my PhD research onward...) in data analysis, of which 5+ years in machine/deep learning.

position_groups:
[{'company': {'id': 13665, 'name': 'Saxion University of Applied Sciences', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQHx7isknIg5gQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1680115797546?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=BKLxjUGzbLo32_cu9-NHIE91yrADL6JdNaLazw_XMq4', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/saxion-hogescholen/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Enschede, Overijssel Province, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Saxion University of Applied Sciences', 'description': 'Researcher / Lecturer in Applied Data Science

Currently working and/or supervising students on the following, mostly data-driven, projects:

- AI-supported sensor systems for improving and competitive grading of horse and (disabled) rider bio-mechanical interaction - a KIEM 2020 project. As principal investigator in the project, I am responsible for the pilot analysis of horse - rider interaction data collected by the EquiMoves™ system. Target applications and follow-ups include:
• Improving horse and (disabled) rider interaction for riders of all skill levels;
• Objective evidence-based classification system for competitive grading of disabled riders in Para Dressage events;
• Identifying biomechanical irregularities for detecting and/or preventing injuries of horses.

- Design in IoT - a RAAK mkb project - in my role as "Methodology workgroup" leader, I am responsible for analysing existing best practices in IoT development, to develop new, or improve upon existing, methodologies for IoT development.

- Fostering the creation of regional (Overijssel, Gelderland) cooperative networks between industrial and academic partners (Cluster for digital monitoring of animal behaviour, animal health and animal welfare (x3D) - an EFRO project).

Past projects I was involved in:
- Use of Big Data technology for detecting the overexertion of athletes - a RAAK-publiek project.
- Predicting Legionella in cooling tower installations from live data (Data in Smart Industry - a RAAK-mkb project).
- Monitoring the dyke digging behaviour of protected (beavers) and invasive (coypu/nutria and muskrat) animal species (Dyke diggers in focus - a RAAK-publiek project).
- Integrating computer vision for safe, robust, accurate and reliable autonomous navigation of mobile industrial robots (Next-Generation Navigation - a RAAK-mkb project).', 'title': 'Researcher / Lecturer Applied Data Science', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 1808395, 'name': 'IKNL (Integraal Kankercentrum Nederland)', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQGYz_UOw61BYw/company-logo_400_400/0/1580984541627?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=KD7HfMrkBf7VId46ZLAlMO1woflH_3Bc8CKucVHr0vk', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/iknl/', 'employees': {'start': 501, 'end': 1000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Enschede Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'IKNL (Integraal Kankercentrum Nederland)', 'description': 'Building models for simulating the effects of re-structuring the follow-up of breast cancer patients, taking into account the individual risks of recurrence, the wish of the patient on the organization of care, the burden for the patient and reduction of healthcare costs.
Datasets: IKNL Breast cancer registry', 'title': 'Guest Researcher', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 166686, 'name': 'Universiteit Twente', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQGlJy8j9vKdjA/company-logo_400_400/0/1533909472654?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=I14FtFFTE3LlyMZrUtaHW6UL3SlP63spT_WEaSbvux4', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/university-of-twente/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Enschede Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'University of Twente', 'description': "a) Building models for simulating the effects of re-structuring the follow-up of breast cancer patients, taking into account the individual risks of recurrence, the wish of the patient on the organization of care, the burden for the patient and reduction of healthcare costs.
